_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Worthington Foods manufactures a variety of prepared food products at our facility in Clearfield.   We have a strong commitment to operate our facility in a safe and responsible manner.



Ammonia is used at our facility as the cooling medium in our refrigeration systems.  Similar to the function Freon plays in a home or car air conditioning system, ammonia is used to cool the air in our industrial freezers and product coolers.  The ammonia is contained in a closed loop system; it is designed to remain inside the piping and vessels in our facility.  We believe that ammonia provides the safest and most efficient cooling choice for our operation.





A. Describe the Accident Release Prevention and Emergency Policies



Worthington Foods takes many precautions to prevent or minimize accidental releases of ammonia from the refrigeration systems.  These precautions include safety controls (alarms and automatic shutdown devices) which are designed to identify and prevent potentially unsafe conditions like pressure increases that could cause a system failure.  We also have a preventive maintenance program designed to maintain the on-going integrity of the systems, a training program designed to ensure that the systems are operated by qualified personnel, and emergency response procedures which enable trained personnel to respond quickly to system upsets.



The Engineering and Facilities Manager is responsible for the management of these ammonia safety programs.





B.   Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled



The Worthington Food's Clearfield Plant produces prepared food products for sale to the public.  Ammonia is the only substance covered by the Accidental Release Prevention Regulations handled at the Clearfield Plant.





C.   Description of the Accidental Release Prevention Program



The facility has an accident release prevention program that complies with Occupational Safety and Health Act's Process Safety Management Standard and EPA's Risk Manage

ment Program Regulation.  The prevention program consists of the following elements:



- Employee Participation Program 

- Process Safety Information 

- Process Hazard Analysis 

- Operating Procedures

- Training Program

- Contractor Safety Program

- Pre-Startup Safety Review Procedures

- Mechanical Integrity Program

- Hot Work Permit Procedures

- Management of Change Procedures

- Incident Investigation Procedures

- Compliance Audit Procedures





D.   Five-Year Accident History



No ammonia-related accidents have occurred at the Clearfield plant over the past five years that resulted in significant on-site or offsite consequences. 





E.   Description of the Emergency Response Program



An emergency response program has been implemented at the Clearfield Plant.  This program contains procedures describing how the facility will respond to ammonia spills and other emergencies, including evacuation procedures.  The program has been coordinated with the North Davis Fire District.





G. Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Worthington Foods is committed to operating our ammonia refrigeration system in a safe and responsible manner.  We are evaluating changes to the ammonia detection system to improve safety at the facility.
